meanings.sent1: The man was blinded by the bright light.
meanings.sent2: She was blinded by the sudden flash of lightning.
meanings.sent3: The cat was blinded by the laser pointer, thinking it was a real bug.
meanings.sent4: His judgment was blinded by his emotions, leading to poor decisions.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the sunset blinded her with its vibrant colors.

meanings.sent1: The blinded puppy bumped into the furniture.
meanings.sent2: The explorer was blinded by the darkness of the cave.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick left the audience temporarily blinded.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was so strong that she felt blinded to his faults.
meanings.sent5: The fog was so thick that it seemed to have blinded the entire city.

meanings.sent1: The blinded bat relied on echolocation to navigate.
meanings.sent2: The injured bird was temporarily blinded in one eye.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's hilarious jokes left the audience blinded with tears of laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of failure blinded her from seeing the opportunities ahead.
meanings.sent5: The dense fog outside the window seemed to have blinded the view of the street.
